Reviews.Title: “Nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: Besanc0n
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night on 20th May 2010 at approx EUR50/night with breakfast included (which is a trap, i'll detail later) and ensuite bathroom (terrible also) This hotel is an absolute nightmare for couples. I chose this hotel as it was affordable and near the termini as we had to catch an early train to Naples. Cons: - The locality is not nice as at night the area is filled with drunk people roaming the area around termini in the cheap bars/night clubs. - The lady at the reception showed us in the room, there is one key to enter into a corridor from the stairs, and then one for the room. she scared us that whenever you enter from the stairs, close and lock the door behind you immediately and also keep your room locked when inside. I am sure she had all the good intentions but just and idea for you its an unsafe locality. - The ensuite bathroom was like a narrow alley with the shower head right above the toilet seat. No soap, no gel, not even a towel. No bathroom amenities at all. - The rooms are sad and depressing. Everything is old, the furniture, the paint etc. - The breakfast was the biggest joke/treachery. When we came down the morning for bf, a voucher for bf is given to us both to get bf from a cafe behind the block. We went there and found a smallest cafe and the salesperson was not happy to see us. We were told to pick one pastry and a coffee. I picked up two pastries so he said that you will not get a coffee as you have taken two pastries! where's the sense in that?!! the pastries/croissants were not so good either. Me and my wife were glad the nightmare was over in 1 night and we didn't stay more. We promised ourselves never to end up in a hotel like that and pay the extra little bit for a decent stay even for 1 night, I have backpacked solo also through europe, and even as a budget backpacker I won't stay here. If you want to stay close to termini to catch an early train, then pay a little more and stay in a decent hotel. Avoid this hotel at all cost!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pick a better spot”
Reviews.Author: DovelyOrlando
Reviews.Content: Sacrifice the location for something more quiet and hospitable. When we arrived at 9pm the man behind the counter acted like we were interrupting him. He was brusk when he did speak and didn't explain anything about how breakfast worked like a normal place that provides breakfast does. The towels were like sand paper, there wasn't any toilet paper in the room the first night, there were dead bugs in the cabinets, and there wasn't enough hot water for the second person taking a much needed, relaxing shower. Our sleep was terrible because the door didn't block any sound and they put us in the only room that was outside of the reception area by the elevator on the first floor. We could hear everything happening outside of our room.

Reviews.Title: “I had expected better”
Reviews.Author: R0zaS
Reviews.Content: Caput Mundi is very close to the train station Roma Termini, it is very comfortable, but, unfortunately, it is the only good thing about the hotel. Seriously, I couldn't have imagined that it would be like this. Let's start with bad points. The room was not cosy, tidy or comfortable. You could've seen dirt in it. Once I've seen the cockroach! Brrrr. There was not everyday cleaning either. The bed was unpleasant, like all the other furniture. The climax of my discontent was the bathroom. If you are not the one who want to take a shower, you should wait until the heater is ready. Also, our room was on the 1st floor close to the public bathroom, and the heater was the one, so in the morning it is simply impossible to take a warm shower. About tranquility. During the evenings I often heard shouts of foreigners in different languages, cause it is not the best quarter in Rome. I suppose, that is the reason of absence of view from the room. The window was hammered. Also, we had couple of mornings, when there was pretty noisy at the hotel. The receptionist told us that there were "special days", when she was shouting at some workers. The noise from the workers also was rather appreciable. The breakfast was in the room, as they didn't have space for it, but it is very poor and the same all the time. The staff was good for us. There were Russian girl Katya during some days who spoke Russian, English and Italian and was very nice, friendly Italian man during some nights and unfriendly Italian oldman during other nights. Some people wrote that he was a real nighmare, but we hadn't any problems with him. Do not speak English with him, say him "Buona notte", and he will be glad. But best of all do not choose this hotel planning your trip to Rome, yeah, it is rather cheap, but don't.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, cheap but poor quality”
Reviews.Author: giemeigi
Reviews.Content: Hotel really well located, but have to improve a lot. The first night we have to sleep in a room behind the reception, so the noise was awful and we couldn't sleep...the other 3 nights we sleep in a room that was OK... The pstaff as very helpful and friendly, but the structure of the hotel must be improve and modernize a lot!!!!

Reviews.Title: “dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: gilbert036
Reviews.Content: great location awful hotel nothing like the web site stayed on fifth floor no air con no hairdryer no bar no lounge no dining room all of which advertised my daughter paid as a present but they would not let us leave until we paid cash for the stay as they said we could not use her card, most rude and said we could not sign although my daughter had given all her details and they had accepted the payment

Reviews.Title: “5 stars for Katrina the polyglot receptionist !”
Reviews.Author: pbmusician
Reviews.Content: I do hope the owners of this hotel realise what a treasure they have in this impeccably dressed well mannered and most hepful receptionist who was a beacon of light in an overwhelmingly shabby but cheerful establishment. She would grace any one of the 5 star establishments anywhere in the world.in the world. She was the magnificent difference between a stay you might want to forget but will always remember. The other big upside is the location location location. Walk out of termini turn left go 100m cross the road and there you are. NOTHING COULD BE CLOSER. Just don't be put off by the Adams family exterior, the hangers on who congregate on the steps day and night, the broom cupboard reception, the incredibly ancient wheezy asthmatic lift. and the fort knox type steel door with 5 deadlocks on the 5th floor, where if you slam the room door too hard, the architrave falls off !!!. Just remember the lovely Katrina is downstairs and all will be well. She will even join you at 8am for your coffee and a bun round the corner if you are lucky. Rooms were ok for the price and reasonbly equipped and clean.

Reviews.Title: “we were robbed”
Reviews.Author: MarcusFreitas
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for five people, air conditioning, private bathroom. When we reached the hotel, asked to stay with our passports and not leave. We look forward to close the book and got on. When we reached the floor of the rooms, the maid told us that it had the room we had booked and gave us a room to two people, one quarter to three, but no private bathroom. Still, he said he would be giving us a bottle of wine and two bottles of water. The bottles were not sealed and therefore do not drink anything. The other day we went to see the city and when we returned, our things were all in the hall because they had occupied our rooms and put us in another room for five people, with private bathroom but no air conditioning. When we were taking our stuff to another room, the maid was praising one of the things the girls and then we left the hotel we noticed that she stole a belt, a scarf and an earring. The hotel is old, dirty, ugly, they do not respect the customer. are dishonest. night receptionist is rude. Anyway, the hotel is awful.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect trip!”
Reviews.Author: godess83
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect choice for those who wanna enjoy their staying in Rome for quite an appropriate sum of money! Ideal location of the hotel in the center of the city, pleasant and very polite receptionist, who speaks 3 ore more languages and always ready to give a helping hand, small but very comfortable rooms! So if you want to enjoy Rome and save your money Caput Mundi Hotel is the perfect choice!

Reviews.Title: “Actually it was very nice!”
Reviews.Author: doctorRussia
Reviews.Content: Before booking the hotel I had read all comments on this web site, I must tell the truth I was afraid to book there. But I had no choice, as I needed a hotel in the centre and I didn't have much money. When I arrived in the hotel, a very friendly lady met me at the reception. She speaks a very good english, and I had no difficulty at checking-in. She let me choose the room I liked more as they had more rooms free. When I saw the room, it was very nice (I mean for the money that I paid). They offered me breakfast in the morning. I went to a cinese bar and had a very good cup of coffee and a bun. I stayed there for three days, and I enjoyed my stay. The cleaner was also very nice. I spoke a lot with these two ladies. They helped me with everything I needed. So certainly I advise going there.

Reviews.Title: “only if u wanna add a distaste to your lovely roman vaccations”
Reviews.Author: kakFrance
Reviews.Content: in short, it should not be rated as a hotel...rude staff, beds seem to be of 1800s also keeping u up all the night...breakfast with a croissant and a cold coffee makes it a pleasant morning and u never wanna return to your hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Bob-a-Link
Reviews.Content: After reading several uncomplimentary reviews on this hotel, I was hesitant to make reservations, but decided to go ahead. I followed up my hostel site reservation which included a deposit with an e-mail directly to the hotel. They responded with my reservation confirmation and answered all my questions. Upon arrival, the receptionist was able to show us two possible rooms. A couple of friends had decided to tag along to see if they could also get a room and were successful. The daytime receptionist was courteous, helpful and spoke fluent English. The antique elevator was able to transport our luggage and us to the fifth floor. We did have to navigate several interesting locks to reach our room, but the security made us feel safer. The room was adequate and was ensuite. It did overlook the street and Termini, but we had no problem with noise which was a concern. Our friend's room had air conditioning, but our room could only have a window opened for cooling. We chose this room on purpose. The location was fabulous being right across the street from Termini and all the links to buses, trains and subways. Termini also had a wide variety of eateries, shops and tourist info. A Continental Breakfast was included and was served at a restaurant across the street in Termini. One note would be to not arrive in the evening because the gentleman who manned the desk then does not appear to speak English. They also held our luggage for most of a day after we checked out before we boarded a train. We were allowed to use the office internet for short periods of time for free to check for important e-mails which was a nice surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to Get to, Not Easy to Stay”
Reviews.Author: LSETerp
Reviews.Content: My friends booked a room here for our stay in Rome, and right away we had problems. Their website said that we could pay by credit card, that breakfast was included and that there was free wireless internet. None of these things turned out to be true, which meant a late-night run to the ATM to withdraw hundreds of euros to pay for our entire stay. The room we had fit all five of us, but just barely: a double bed, a single bed, and two single beds that pulled down from the wall left very little space to move around. It seemed like the room used to be a moderately sized ensuite hotel room with one double bed, but then more were added so they can make more money. The one good thing about this place is its location, which is literally across the street from the main train/bus/metro station. This isn't a particularly nice part of the city, but it is convenient for traveling. Other than that not much to recommend: the sheets didn't feel or smell clean, we had to chose between opening the window to lots of noise or being in a hot room, and an old man at the front desk who stays up all night smoking and pounding on your door saying "Silencio" if you are talking. Overall it's ok to put up with for one night, but if you're staying for longer then find somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Took many nights to be able to sleep with the light out again ”
Reviews.Author: shellaree65
Reviews.Content: It was our first time overseas, had short time to plan the trip as the main reason was for business in Barcelona. Thought it would be great to see Rome on the way home. On arrival ,even though we had reservations they said they didn’t have our booking. Sheer terror over took us as it was late and we had no idea of any where else at that time of night. They managed to find us a room…more like a cage. Window opens into other building. Toilet didn’t flush. All keys to room are the same. Other residents were extremely loud…was their ritual to the building with much noisiness after 11pm and return as the sun came up. We were sure we would lose our organs. The price and rating was well over stated. Interesting breakfast included. NEVER STAY AT CAPUT MUNDI – ROME

Reviews.Title: “stay away from Caput Mundi!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lobepra
Reviews.Content: HOTEL CAPUT MUNDI: bad choice indeed!!! They WILL CANCEL YOUR RESERVATION at the last minute with an excuse, if they will find a longer and gainful reservation. Happened that to us four friends, during the Maratona days in 2007: after 2 months that they had confirmed the reservation and validated it even 2 days before, the morning before the day of our arrival, they said WITH A SOLE E-MAIL that they don’t accepted us anymore!!! (We kept all the messages between them and us, as proof).

Reviews.Title: “Cheats Never stay here”
Reviews.Author: vkmoorthy
Reviews.Content: We had reservations at this hotel through orbitz. We arrived around 7.30 p.m. and gave the recpetionist the reservation confirmation printout from orbitz. The guy started shouting at us in italian. HE thrw the register book at us and started saying all full. even though we told him we had confirmation he didnot give us a room. Terrible people no manners nevery stay there. so not trust these guys.

Reviews.Title: “Rip OFF!!! Never stay here”
Reviews.Author: SP00078
Reviews.Content: Never ever stay here!!! After thinking I was ok going through Expedia and getting a hotel reserved online, I traveled to Rome. When I got there I exited the station walked a few blocks to this hotel. It was very late I just wanted to check in. Immediately I knew I was in trouble as the owner of the Hotel demanded cash for the stay. 290 euros in one lump sum.... Uh no way dude. I told him he had my credit card, gave him the confirmation code which he did not understand because he did not speak english. So I pulled out my expedia reservation sheet. Still he demanded cash. Knowing I was in trouble I just left. And found a wonderful hotel down the street known as the Hotel Ariston. Never stay here very shaddy place. And oh try to avoid the expedia deals.

Reviews.Title: “Waste of money (110 EUR / night)”
Reviews.Author: Surferin
Reviews.Content: Bathroom tiny and no fresh towels when old ones obviously not to be used anymore. No hair-dryer. Very unfriendly man at the desk. Hotel hard to find - in the fith floor with a dangerous lift. All the nights have to be paid at arrival CASH even thought the door is full of VISA,.... stickers.... In the mornings there was a very nice young lady which was the only sunshine in that hotel. Thanks to her we afterall enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever ever stay here”
Reviews.Author: Italyveteran
Reviews.Content: The Caput Mundi is Caput It was October, Rome was packed, I had to stay two nights in the city for work and I was forced to stay at the Caput Mundi when nothing else was available. Now I wish I would have slept on a park bench. My twin room was so narrow it had two beds arranged head to toe and it was impossible to make it from one end of the room to the other without climbing over furniture. Because of the room set-up only one person could watch TV at a time and there was nowhere in the room to put luggage. The hotel staff were unhelpful and rude; the hotel was noisy; and we were kept awake by the night porter having loud arguments with guests and smoking endless cigarettes directly outside our room. To top it off, I attempted to pay by credit card, but the receptionist told me my card was defective (after swiping it) and insisted I pay cash. I ended up paying twice for the priveledge of staying in this hell hole. Do not stay at this hotel under any circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Garbage - From Staff to Property Itself”
Reviews.Author: jillybeansxo
Reviews.Content: DO NOT, I repeat, DO NOT stay in this hotel. It is a small one level place situated in a multi level apartment right next to Termini. The original check in girl was very nice, but when we had issues with the room an older Italian guy was at the desk - completely ripped us off. Very unfriendly. pretended to not speak English so that he could rip off the American/Irish newbies to Rome we were. We actually left early because this guy was so rude and crazy, we were afraid of what he may do to our belongings when we left for the day. Went next door to a cute B and B and couldn't have been happier...we are experienced travelers...looking for a decent property that is safe, and clean..and did not find this in the Caput Mundi. TRUST ME...there are far better places out there....email me with any questions

Reviews.Title: “does not honor reservations”
Reviews.Author: lasavant
Reviews.Content: Made reservations in March 2006 and received a confirmation #. Called the hotel in July 2006 to reconfirm. Arrived at Hotel Caput Mundi, morning of September 20, 2006 only to be told that we did not have reservations. When I showed my reservation confirmation I was told our rooms had been given away and there was nothing the hotel could do for us. We had to find 3 hotel rooms for 5 nights in Rome, on our own. The hotel staff and the WRH Hotels Network customer service desk completely ignored our plight and offered no help at all. I would not recommend using WRH Hotels Network to any traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Try somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: kmr22
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a big disappointment. Five people--three days--NO HOT WATER!! They did give us a 15 euro reduction after much arguing over the situation.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here during our European vacation in May. We had already booked here when we read in our European travel guide that the area south of the Main train station (which is where the Caput Mundi is located) was not a very nice part of town. The good news is that it was a close walk from the train station. However, the area was very dirty and there were a lot of seedy characters standing or walking aimlessly around the premises (probably the reason for the bars on the windows in the rooms). Rome in general was one of the dirtier cities we visited in Europe, but this area was especially bad. I wouldn't go so far as to say we felt unsafe, but it was not a pleasant part of town to be in and we made sure to get back before dark most nights. The lobby reaked of cigarette smoke which was made worse by the fact that our room was 3 feet from the front desk. We could hear everything happening at this front desk and they could probably hear us. The room wasn't nice, but not any worse than some of the other places we stayed throughout Europe. However, for the price (about $140 USD/night) we were highly disappointed with our stay and it made Rome a slightly less enjoyable experience for us. I personally would have spent more time looking for a better value and would probably stay away from the area south of the Train station.

Reviews.Title: “Truely awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel. I never write these reveiws but I felt that I had to for this hotel. This hotel was dirty, the staff were very unfriendly, breakfast was eaten in a cafe down the road (thankfully as you wouldn't eat there). I was woken at 2am with people banging on the hotel door looking for the room they had booked. I eventually answered the door, then the doorman graced us with his presence! The window in our room - on the fifth floor led to the roof, so it was covered with metal bars!!! No fire escape whatsoever! The door to our room had once been broken, had been fixed with masking tape. Didn't make you feel confident about leaving your stuff in the room when you were out. I wish now that i had read peoples reviews before booking this hotel, as I could have done without it.....

Reviews.Title: “Seedy Dump”
Reviews.Author: ladyinmaryland
Reviews.Content: The only redeeming qualities for this hotel is it's 5 minute proximity to Rome Train Terminal and "Jacqueline", the receptionist. We booked over the Internet and had it not been for our last night in Italy after traveling for 1 week, we would have not checked into this seedy hotel in a seedy area. You can see the sights near the terminal vacinity during the day, but as it gets dark, I'd be checked into my room. The accomodations were so bad, we didn't even bother to get the included breakfast which is not even in the hotel, they have to give you a ticket and you go elsewhere to cash it in. My 11 year old son and I checked out in the morning and were thankful to say arrivaderci to Caput Mundi. P.S. Be warned that despite advertisments that they take credit cards, they have a posting that says their machine is broken and want you to pay otherwise. I insisted on them finding a way to charge to the credit card. Also, this hotel is literally BEHIND the train station, DO NOT GET SCAMMED by the Local Taxi Drivers!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “**warning** do not use”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Turned up to Sunshine house to be told our "confirmed" reservation was no good and we were rudely told we would have to go elsewhere. It was a relief to be turned away as it looked dirty and we did not feel safe in the building anyway. Do not under any circumstance book here would be my personal recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “We're so lucky that they didn't honor our paid-in-advance reservations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When my girlfriend and I got to Sunshine House on a very hot and humid Friday afternoon, we were frightened by the vandalized buildings that led to the building. We took the dirty elevator up only to wait in front of their reception desk for close to an hour without anybody showing up to talk to us. Finally, a very rude voice in PA system told us to go downstairs. There, we were told that our booking was no good, and by now we were glad that we would be freed from such a dump. Simona, the lobby receptionist was a bit polite, but she still refused to help us find a new place. We ended up leaving our luggage at Termini while we searched for another hotel in a better part of town. Given the danger, filth, and poor service at Sunshine House, we were glad to pay a little bit more and stay somewhere else. Whatever you do, do not stay at, or in the neighborhood, of Sunshine House. Try Via Nazionale, they have many hotels there and, without advertising for the one where we stayed, the area is safer even at night. Whereas, Sunshine House was scary even at daytime.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay there ”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am in Italy at the moment after leaving the so called "Sunshine house". In short, no water, air-con broken, tv broken and a very rude old man at front desk whom reacts to these issues by shouting. There are many decent hotels in the area but this is definetly not one of them DO NOT STAY THERE!

Reviews.Title: “Yet another bad experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrived in late evening with 2 young children and confirmed booking in hand to be told there was no reservation. Not fun. Eventually they gave us a more expensive room for one night but we had to treck across Rome to a new (much better) hotel next morning. Lift was filthy. Staff in hotel tried to be helpful but boss who does bookings isn't there. Basically don't book because they are unreliable and building is dirty.

Reviews.Title: “They ripped us off!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: DONT stay here. Three couples booked rooms for end of October and all three of us received confirmations back on email. on arrival, NO ROOMS. They had sold all of our rooms and gave us no help in finding another set of rooms. We had to pay extra and double bunk in two rooms that evening. The guy at the front desk told us that we had to go to the rail station and stand in line for the Hotel Booking agency and he offered no help. we met another couple leaving who had the same thing told to them. in total, four rooms confirmed and then resold. these guys are crooks and should be SHUT DOWN. kw

Reviews.Title: “lucky escape”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am unable to give a full review of Sunshine House but I would like to warn others about it. I booked this accomodation over the internet & when we arrived outside the building the taxi driver was reluctant to let us out of his cab, informing us that the area was not safe for my family to stay in. He described the place as a hostel & not a family run B&B as described on the website I booked it on. Having seen the gang of young men hanging around the entrance to Sunshine House and the condition of the surrounding area, we did not take much convincing to find another hotel. Only wish I had know about this website before I booked it.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Stay Here!!!”
Reviews.Author: JillytLiverpool
Reviews.Content: It was the worst night of my life! It is in a horrible location with gangs of youths hanging around the entrance making lewd comments to passers by. It is run by a doddering old man who does not know what is going on. The room was ok but we had bunk beds not a double bed as requested. The bathroom was dirty and without towels. You have been warned!!

Reviews.Title: “Pay! Pay now!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found it not quite as bad as the other reviewer reported. The room I had was comfortable enough, with A/C, a TV, and a sink. (Note: the only bathroom is shared among 7 people!) Not spotless, but I wouldn't call it dirty. It is in the absolute worst part of town, but it is extremely close to the train and metro station, very convenient. Breakfast is a pre-packaged croissant and (good, as is all Italian) coffee. It was going as a solid 2-star rating until... On my last night there just before midnight a gruff old man started banging on my door shouting what apparently was the only non-Italian he knew, "Pay! Pay now!" I hadn't seen anyone like him around before, and because of the seedy neighborhood I worried that he might have been a shady character who had gotten inside the main door and was trying a ploy to get me to open my door, since this was pretty unusual behavior for a legitimate innkeeper. I tried to communicate in a couple languages (not Italian) and all I could get was "Pay now" interspersed with salvos of angry Italian. He pretended to call the police on the phone two different times, and after a long while he eventually gave up. The fellow tending shop in the morning said that it probably had indeed been the night attendant and apologized several times for that interchange, but the whole experience still dropped my assessment of the lodging a notch. BTW, their web site makes it look like a family operation; I never saw any of them, and where I stayed was apparently another B&B in the same building (Antonietta's House) they were either reselling or had bought. In all, you get what you pay for, and I paid for the cheapest accommodation I could find (70 Euros/night) within walking distance of historical Roma. I'd say it rates a 1.5 / 5.0, because it could have been dirtier and I wasn't actually robbed.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Caput Mundi Roma
HotelInfo.Address: Via Urbano Rattazzi 65, 00185 Rome, Italy
